queries.description: A switch statement should have an appropriate structure with proper cases, default labels, and break statements to ensure clear control flow and prevent unintended fall-through behavior.
queries.name: The structure of a switch statement shall be appropriate

RULE-9-4-2.title: The structure of a switch statement shall be appropriate

queries.description: Legacy for statements with complex initialization, condition, and increment expressions can be difficult to understand and maintain. Simple for loops are more readable.
queries.name: Legacy for statements should be simple

RULE-9-5-1.title: Legacy for statements should be simple

queries.description: Multiple function calls in a for-range-initializer can lead to unclear iteration behavior and potential side effects that make the code harder to understand and debug.
queries.name: A for-range-initializer shall contain at most one function call

RULE-9-5-2.title: A for-range-initializer shall contain at most one function call
